p: MMP-2 was the first endopeptidase recognized to degrade collagens and to be related to the invasive and metastatic potential of cancer cells [ 45]. The active form of MMP-2 co-localizes with a pro-form of MMP-9 in various types of cancer, being able to activate it, consequently increasing tumor malignancy [ 50]. On the other hand, MMP-9 is linked to the promotion of metastization, angiogenesis and cell survival [ 23]. Since A. vera has been shown to concomitantly exhibit anti-inflammatory and anti-cancer activities, it appears reasonable to infer that targeting MMP-9 (a known key player in both conditions) could be one of Aloeâ€™s biocomponents mode of action.
